properties.areaDesc: Wilcox; Wayne; Washington; Butler; Crenshaw; Choctaw; Monroe; Clarke
properties.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued February 20 at 6:36AM CST until February 20 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Mobile AL
properties.description:
The Flash Flood Watch continues for

* Portions of Alabama and southeast Mississippi, including the
following areas, in Alabama, Butler, Choctaw, Clarke,
Crenshaw, Monroe, Washington, and Wilcox. In southeast
Mississippi, Wayne.

* Until 6 PM CST this evening

* Moderate to locally heavy rain will spread across interior
portions of southeast Mississippi and southwest and south
central Alabama through this afternoon. Rainfall amounts of 1
to 2 inches with locally higher totals over 3 inches will be
possible, especially along and north of a Waynesboro to Grove
Hill to Luverne line.

* Soils remain saturated in the Flash Flood Watch area. Heavy
rainfall in a short period of time will make conditions
favorable for flooding of urban and low lying areas.
Additional river rises may also worsen ongoing river flooding.
properties.instruction:
A Flash Flood Watch means that conditions may develop that lead
to flash flooding. Flash flooding is a VERY DANGEROUS SITUATION.

You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action
should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

NWSheadline: FLASH FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST THIS EVENING
